title: Is your Updated Client not working?   You've come to the right place!
body:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/retiringair_alt_1080.jpg

Hey all,

It's a new age!  With the deprecation of the Legacy Client (AKA, the AIR client) now completed, there might be a few unfamiliar errors or issues you might get when launching the Updated Client.  We took some of the most common ones and investigated them to give you the best and easiest solution so you never have to see it again.

------------------------------------------------

>#***Why does the End of Game Stats screen take FOREVER to freakin' load?!***

This might be due to the "Close Client During Game" option in the client.  This option makes the client close out when you enter a game, which means after the game it has to completely reboot to start.  Low Spec Mode should be enough to keep things running smoothly, so disable this option by entering the client, clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner, [and unchecking the box.](http://i.imgur.com/smwR8be.png)

>#***“I’ve tried the Updated Client before, and it was sooooo laggy”***

 We've made some massive changes to the Updated Client make it run as smoothly as possible, even on the proudest of potatoes.  Enable Low Spec Mode if it isn’t on already.  You can find out by clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner of the Updated Client and then [click "Enable Low Spec Mode"](http://i.imgur.com/rPGRnYW.png)

>#***"Patching Failed and we're not sure why Error: 004"***

This error usually occurs when Operating System Permissions isn't set properly.  Essentially, the patcher is trying to access files found on your hard drive, but it is being denied from doing so.  [Follow the steps in this guide to get this resolved!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

>#***"Something's up with our servers and it's preventing you from patching" Error: 003***

Occurs when the patcher isn't able to maintain a stable connection with our Patcher Servers.  If the patcher loses connection to the server to get the necessary files, it will simply stop working.  To get this resolved, [make sure to complete all of the solutions in this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

>#***Weirdness with Rune Pages***

There can be an issue with rune pages not saving correctly when they have ***special characters*** in their name.  We're working on solving this in the future, but if this error happens to you, reach out to us in a [ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll get you squared away.

--------------------------------------

If you have a problem that isn’t here or those solutions aren’t working, drop a comment below and we’ll be sure to respond and help you out!  ^.^

Why do I only have access to item sets on _**recently played**_ champions while _**in-game**_?

I get that the feature is being remade for the new client, but as it stands, only a handful of my champions can use the 'global' item sets that I made (AP, AD, Tank, Support, etc.). My item sets were designed to give me **_easy access to all relevant items_** for a particular class, but now I'm forced to use the "recommended" items for 75% of my champion pool. To be honest, the recommended item pages are a complete joke, especially in terms of wasted space (one item per-line? seriously?), and now I'm forced to waste time searching for items.

Can we please at least have **_in-game_** item set functionality restored until the system can be remade for the client?

Hey LoopKat,

The global item sets are applied to the champions as you load them up in game rather than when you're in the client and make the item set. If you made a global item set but didn't play the champion from the old client so its sets would be updated, you can manually apply them through a little bit (for a few champions) of manual work or by making a new set through a [3rd party item set creation tool](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/hozFyetY-webtool-eye-popping-item-set-editor).

If you want to do it manually per champion, all you need to do is open up your League config folder typically found at **C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**, go into the **Champions** folder, copy a champion folder that already has the sets you want, and rename it to the appropriate champion.
